main event: A man driving his car along the highway in Temple, Oklahoma noticed an unidentified object parked on the road in front of him on March 23, 1966.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a conventional aircraft without wings or motors, and had a plexiglass bubble on top similar to a B-26 canopy.
As the observer approached, he noticed a man wearing a baseball cap enter the object by steps from the bottom.
After the man entered, the object rose from the pavement and headed in a southeasterly direction at approximately 720 mph, making a high-speed drill-like noise.
The object was approximately 75 feet long, nearly 8 feet from top to bottom, and about 12 feet wide, with some type of supports on the bottom.

Despite attempts to identify the object as an experimental or conventional aircraft, no such aircraft could be found in the area at the time of the sighting, leading the Air Force to list the case as unidentified.
